info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF RIPLEY COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Osgood, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Sunman, Holton, Napoleon, Versailles Lake, Otter Village, Ballstown, Penntown, New Marion and Interstate 74 at State Route 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
